column2: Skills        Daycare      pre primary Teacher      teacher      Montessori      daycare teacher      Teaching          We are hiring a Daycare Teacher to join our team at InfoWryt Solutions LLP. As a Daycare Teacher, you will be responsible for providing a safe and nurturing environment for children under your care. This is a full-time position based in Bangalore.              Qualifications and Skills                Minimum of a high school diploma or equivalent      Previous experience working in a daycare or preschool setting      Passion for working with children and promoting their development      Excellent communication and interpersonal skills      Patience, compassion, and the ability to handle challenging situations      Basic understanding of child development and early childhood education      Certification in CPR and first aid is preferred      Ability to work well in a team environment                Roles and Responsibilities                Create and implement age-appropriate educational and recreational activities for children      Monitor and ensure the safety of children at all times      Foster a positive and nurturing environment for children's development      Collaborate with parents and provide regular updates on their child's progress      Maintain cleanliness and organization of the daycare facility      Assist with meal times and provide assistance with toilet training      Administer basic first aid when necessary      Follow and enforce all daycare policies and procedures      Attend staff meetings and training sessions as required

column2: Work closely with ART centres and targeted interventions staff (peer educators, out-reach workers) to profile the children who are eligible for services under Orphan and Vulnerable services of the Project ACCELERATE.                               The job responsibilities include working both in the facility (ART and Link ART Centre) and in the community with extended travel to TIs, meeting with community networks, household visits to support delivery of services.                               Introduce about the OVC activities to the parents of CLHIV, children of PLHIV and adolescents of key population. Provide nutrition monitoring, linkages to health/NCD screening, support linkages with existing health/nutrition/social benefits, leverage donor/CSR support to implement various activities, ensure treatment adherence and viral load monitoring support.                               Work closely with ART Centre, Integrated Counselling and Testing Center (ICTC),Vihaan Project, PLHIV networks and organisations working with CLHIV to profile the beneficiaries who need OVC services.                               Prepare the care givers and/or parents and build their skills to take care of the beneficiaries.                               Undertake needs assessment of children and caregiver, prepare care plan to deliver services through the Project ACCELERATE or link with other agencies providing similar services as necessary.                               Work with Key Population groups, PLHIV networks, Adolescent Groups and Clubs to understand the needs, collect feedback on the services received accordingly help the project to improve the quality and scale of the services.                               Conduct risk assessment among adolescents being served by the project, provide HIV testing services and those who are identified HIV positive to be linked with ART services.                               Conduct Life Skills Education Session among the adolescents. Conduct mental health counselling for care givers, conduct treatment adherence counselling for the parents and adolescents to improve treatment retention among children and adolescents on ART services.                               Counselling caregivers in improving child care at home, identify early warning signs of child health, improve linkages with immunisation and nutrition services. Help improve linkages with education activities, social protection services. Help link with livelihood support activities for the caregivers and parents.                               Create a district directory of services, network with local institutions and agencies who can be leveraged to provide such services. Link adolescents and drop-outs to vocational skills training.                               Coordinate with DAPCU single window to facilitate linkage to social protection schemes wherever possible.                               Work closely with TIs, PLHIV networks, ART and ICTCs to manage data.
column11: Service delivery, Nutrition, Risk assessment, Social service, Care Facilitator, Management, Windows, Counselling, Monitoring, Testing

column2: SRMC University is looking for Assistant Professor for Physician Associate to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey      As an Assistant Professor in the field of Physician Associate (PA), you will be responsible for contributing to the academic and professional development of students pursuing a career as Physician Associates      This role involves teaching, curriculum development, clinical supervision, and engaging in scholarly activities to enhance the quality of the Physician Associate program        Key Responsibilities:        Teaching and Instruction:Conduct lectures, seminars, and practical sessions related to the Physician Associate program      Develop and deliver curriculum content aligned with program objectives      Clinical Supervision:Supervise and mentor students during clinical placements and rotations      Facilitate hands-on learning experiences in healthcare settings      Curriculum Development:Contribute to the development and enhancement of the Physician Associate curriculum      Integrate current medical knowledge, clinical skills, and evidence-based practices      Assessment and Evaluation:Develop and administer assessments to evaluate students' medical knowledge and clinical competencies      Provide constructive feedback on clinical performance      Research and Scholarship:Engage in scholarly activities, including research, publications, and presentations      Contribute to the advancement of knowledge in the field of Physician Associate studies      Student Advising:Provide academic and career guidance to Physician Associate students      Mentor students in their academic and professional development      Interprofessional Collaboration:Collaborate with healthcare professionals, faculty, and stakeholders to enhance interprofessional education      Foster collaboration between Physician Associates and other healthcare providers      Professional Development:Stay informed about advancements in medical practices, clinical guidelines, and healthcare technologies      Attend conferences, workshops, and training programs      Committee Participation:Serve on departmental and university committees relevant to the Physician Associate program      Contribute to accreditation processes and program reviews      Quality Assurance:Ensure the quality and relevance of the Physician Associate program through continuous improvement initiatives      Participate in program assessments and accreditation activities

column2: Certainly, here are the Key Result Areas (KRAs) for a qualified Product Developer teaching Tinkering & Crafts, new product development, and problem-solving, with a focus on prototyping: 1. Curriculum Development: Design and update curriculum materials for Tinkering & Crafts and product development courses, incorporating hands-on projects and real-world problem-solving scenarios. 2. Effective Instruction: Deliver engaging and practical lectures, workshops, and demonstrations to teach students principles of tinkering, craftsmanship, and innovative product development methodologies. 3. Prototyping and Hands-on Learning: Facilitate hands-on learning experiences by guiding students through the process of prototyping, testing, and iterating new product concepts using various tools, materials, and techniques. 4. Problem-solving Skills: Develop students' problem-solving skills by challenging them to identify design challenges, brainstorm solutions, and implement effective problem-solving strategies throughout the product development lifecycle. 5. Creativity and Innovation: Foster creativity and innovation among students by encouraging them to explore unconventional ideas, think outside the box, and push the boundaries of traditional design and craftsmanship. 6. Project Management: Provide guidance on project management principles and methodologies to help students effectively plan, execute, and manage product development projects from conception to completion. 7. Industry Engagement: Establish partnerships with industry professionals, organizations, and local businesses to provide students with opportunities for real-world collaboration, mentorship, and exposure to industry best practices. 8. Evaluation and Feedback: Develop fair and constructive assessment methods to evaluate student performance and progress in Tinkering & Crafts and product development, providing timely feedback to support continuous improvement. 9. Research and Development: Engage in ongoing research and development activities to stay abreast of emerging trends, technologies, and best practices in product design, prototyping, and innovation. 10. Professional Development: Pursue continuous professional development opportunities to enhance teaching effectiveness, deepen subject matter expertise, and stay current with advancements in product development methodologies and tools. These KRAs encompass the core responsibilities of a Product Developer instructor, focusing on fostering creativity, problem-solving skills, hands-on learning, and industry relevance in Tinkering & Crafts and new product development education.
column11: Product Development, Prototype, New Product Development, Design Development
